Just by looking at the chart, it the STI didn't seem to move much at at all, whereas the S&P had the historically longest rally since 2008. Buying to the S&P might be expensive now, especially if a potential recession is coming. So just be more careful on that. Also, a DCA strategy may not make sense during a recession. Since the markets are going downhill during a reccession, you might be better off postponing your investments.0 comments0
